newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai Kaikai likely to rise on Wednesday debut.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai Kaikai likely to rise on Wednesday debut.

text.p: Clothes maker Shanghai Kaikai Industrial Co Ltd, which will list 80 million B shares on the Shanghai stock exchange on Wednesday, is expected to perform strongly on the first day of trading, analysts said on Tuesday.
Kaikai is a well-managed company and its initial offering price is low, which will help to offset the present poor conditions on the B share market, they said.
"Kaikai's B share is likely to gain solidly on its first day with the price possibly hitting more than $0.300 per share against an issue price of $0.256," one stock analyst said.
The low issue price has given the share a price earnings ratio of only seven times, according to Shenyin and Wanguo Securities, the lead underwriter of Kaikai's B share issue.

Shenyin said in a research paper published in the Shanghai Securities News on Tuesday that the company was one of China's largest shirt and sweater makers with a 5.7 percent market share for shirts and 2.5 percent for sweaters.
Traders with Shenyin & Wanguo Securities said the stock would rise on the listing day but cautioned the rise would not be great.
"It must be remembered that market conditions are not very good at the moment," said one trader.

The 80 million foreign currency shares were issued last month, raising $19.15 million excluding the issue cost. The company says proceeds will be used to expand the firm's clothing production and to open new sales outlets around China.
